pages.text: Campfires need a flint and steel to light, but are very warm.
Fire pits can cook food with a wok or barbecue rack, but need fuel to cook anything.

Fill an Empty Tank with crude oil, naphtha, or refined fuel to turn it into stackable solid fuel--great for locomotives.$(br2)You can't put fluid buckets in a chest minecart. Use a tank minecart instead.$(br2)Locomotives can draw water from an adjacent tank cart.

Don't add water to a hot, dry locomotive: it can explode. Let it cool down first.$(br2)A train that derails at speed will also explode.$(br2)Pack animals, carts, and trains are all useful for bulk transport.$(br2)The Nether isn't a shortcut any more. Distances in the Nether are the same as in the overworld.

You can pick up most friendly entities and carry them around by shift-right-clicking on them.$(br2)The Structured Crafter is your early-game autocrafter. Later, the Rat Crafting Table is a more compact alternative.$(br2)Pouring water onto quicksand turns it into solid mud.
You'll need a filled Tome of Knowledge for the endgame, so start storing your XP early.$(br2)Right-click a Tome of Knowledge on a fluid container to store XP in liquid form.

One ingot of metal is equivalent to 144 mB of molten metal.$(br2)Basic molds can be made with any metal, but tool molds require lead specifically.$(br2)Crucibles will keep melting items even if they're full, destroying any excess liquid.$(br2)You can brew potions in heated cauldrons, though you only get 2 potions per ingredient.

Watch your step around flickering black spheres.$(br2)Blossoming Trees sometimes have small root caves at their base.$(br2)The Eye of Horus beholds all secrets.$(br2)Search "$guides" in JEI to see the guidebooks included for various mods.
